title: U.S. arrests Iranian over alleged $115 million sanctions evasion scheme
text: March 20, 2018 / 9:41 PM / Updated 34 minutes ago U.S. arrests Iranian over alleged $115 million sanctions evasion scheme Reuters Staff 1 Min Read (Reuters) - An Iranian national has been arrested on U.S. charges that he participated in a scheme to evade U.S. sanctions and funnel more than $115 million paid under a Venezuelan construction contract through the U.S. financial system, prosecutors said on Tuesday. Ali Sadr Hashemi Nejad, 38, was arrested on Monday and charged in a six-count indictment filed in federal court in Manhattan for his role in a scheme to evade U.S. economic sanctions against Iran, prosecutors said. Reporting by Nate Raymond in Boston; Editing by Cynthia Osterman
